Skill: Research Skill: Experiment Design Role: Team or Solo

Skills Demonstrated

  • Example skill that the reader should notice immediately.
  • Another technical or employability skill tied to the project.
  • Communication, project management, or teamwork skill if relevant.

What (Problem & Context)

Describe the problem you set out to solve and why it mattered. Name the class, team, or organization where it originated.

How (Process & Constraints)

Explain your approach, the tools you used, and the constraints or failures you worked through.

  • Constraints: budget, schedule, materials, accuracy, safety, etc.
  • Tools: CAD, fabrication, analysis, programming, test methods.
  • Challenges: what went wrong and how you corrected it.

Why (Results & Impact)

State the results and why they mattered. Quantify impact where possible (e.g., performance, cost, time saved, reliability).

Team & Contribution

If this was a team project, specify your individual contribution and ownership. If solo, say so and highlight the full scope you handled.
